question: At some rate of simple interest, A lent Rs. 6000 to B for 2 years and Rs. 1500 to C for 4 years and received Rs. 900 as interest from both of them together. The rate of interest per annum was:
explanation:
If rate of interest be R% p.a. then, 
$latex S.I. = \\frac{Principal\\times Time\\times Rate}{100}&s=1$
$latex \\therefore \\frac{6000\\times 2\\times R}{100}+\\frac{1500\\times 4\\times R}{100}=900&s=1$
$latex =>120R+60R=900$
$latex =>180R=900$
$latex =>R=\\frac{900}{180}=&s=1$ 5%
Hence option [A] is the right answer
